description:
2 am on a Friday night, drunk after a night out, friends repeating "tacos! I need tacos!" 

And that's what led me to taqueria Vallarta. Taqueria Vallarta and all taco joints around the world open into the wee hours of the morning are true heroes defeating the evil of drunken starvation. 

My pastor tacos literally brought me back to life. They were bomb and they have a salsa bar so you can ~cUsToMiZE~
author: Dallas M.

description:
Generous portion, relatively cheap prices, and no frills. BUT forreal though, 2$ for tacossss. Does that even exist anymore in SF? Please don't ever change that.

When I want Mexican food but I'm too lazy to dine out then this is my go to spot. It's on UberEats so I get to do takeout without having to go there. YAY. Sometimes, the laziness is too strong.

What I usually get are well... tacos! because they're only 2 bucks and they are delicious. Or...when I feel like eating a little bit healthier then I get the meat burrito. It's pretty much a choice of meat, lettuce, tomatoes, avocado. Relatively healthy. That's almost cutting the carbs in half because there's no beans and no rice. But, I feel like pigging out, I get the super burrito.

It's a good spot and it opens late. I like the conveniency.
Again, please don't change and scrimp on the portions or jack up the price too high.
author: Ngoc P.

description:
There's nothing like some authentic Mexican food, no frills. First of all, the restaurant is quite spacious, which I can imagine it being filled up during the drunk and hangry hours. Since we came in at 2pm on a Sunday, it was not very busy. We went for the street tacos, which they serve in a cart on the side. You can see all the various meats cooking up on their grill. I went for two tacos: carne asada and tripitas ($3 each). Per recommendation, the tripitas was delicious! It was my first time having beef tripe in a taco and the crispy texture gave it such great flavor. As for the carne asada, it was pretty standard as a taco.

Even though this spot is pretty authentic, I think I am too spoiled by the best and cheap Mexican food from LA. To add, it's quite pricey for a taco.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
My boyfriend and I got an el pastor burrito to share. We ordered a regular burrito but our total came out to $11 something... "Weirdly expensive", we thought, but had never come here and paid without question. We also don't get a receipt so we were unaware of the mistake then. We get our burrito and me, the hungrier one, starts demolishing it immediately. My boyfriend took only 2 bites when he notices some white sauce... "Is this sour cream? That's what tasted so weird!". 

My boyfriend, who hates dairy, goes up to the same cashier to fix the issue. When he first describes the situation to her, she goes, "So? You got sour cream and guac, why are you complaining?" "Well, I wanted a regular burrito, you even charged me for a super burrito when I didn't want it." Granted, the burrito was half-eaten, but that was me! It wasn't until halfway that we noticed a whole dollop of sour cream, and we were so focused on eating that we hadn't noticed its contents. 

Long story short, the lady refused to refund or remake our burrito, and when my boyfriend gave her back the burrito, she freaking THREW IT at the cooks!!! We were astounded at her attitude. The cooks made us another burrito, the one we actually ordered, but damn, this place left an awful taste in my mouth. Yes, the burritos are bomb, but that lady needs to go.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Some Yelp reviews are easy and then there are the ones that aren't:-/, This is not a pretty review. I can give "Taqueria Vallarta" only 2 stars. 1 for staying open til 1 am, and 2 for having standardized quesadillas.

I got there late night, my 1st time visit. Not greeted and no eye contact from the lady behind the cash register.I asked for a chicken quesadilla and that order went to the kitchen. I also asked for a chicken tamale. She said, "I'll see if we have any." She went into somewhere & came back out,  then put a cold tamale in their microwave. I asked for nacho chips & salsa. She got out a paper plate and put some nacho chips on the plate and pointed to where I could get the salsas. There was a dip station! Unfortunately, the dip station was not very appealing... Spoons and different types of salsas were spilled into each other, on the counter & floors. I chose pico de gallo and sat down.

Chips weren't special & little salt. Salsa had good flavor but watery. My quesadilla came out and it was your basic quesadilla, not much to go wrong here. And it was OK. The tamale on the other hand, tasted old, bland and with small portion of chicken. Wasn't worth it - wasn't eaten.

I know every restaurant can have a bad night. No way of knowing! I don't enjoy my visit on a bad night. I was just gonna leave it at that; not a great visit. Too bad. But as I ate my chips & quesadilla, I couldn't help but notice how filthy their environment actually was. Of course I had to go to the bathroom! Disgusting! Sight and smells.

One last item to mention: I received my Yelp Offer, horchata. Worst horchata taste I have ever had.
author: Van H.

description:
Imagine being jus another taqueria in the mission. Also imagine how much competition you'd have. Located right on 24th Street, this place is serving up authentic bites from Puerto Vallarta. Honestly I walked in because the line at El Farolito was too long - and I was not disappointed!

Right when you walk in there, you can tell this spot is supported by the locals. They have an open kitchen and I believe they have bought two lots because they have an entire dining area as well. Immediately when you enter, there is a taco section that is cash only. Seems like the quick pit stop. For anything else, or paying by card, you walk to the back counter and order.

I got the California Burrito and a chicken quesadilla. Both were so fresh and plentiful with every component. Their style is very distinguishable from that of El Farolito - seeing as Taq Vallarta isn't drunchies. I might have walked in for convenience but I left with quality! Definitely want to go back and sit down for a "wet burrito" (mole).
author: Navila H.

description: I'm a very picky taco enthusiast, if the meat ain't good, the whole taco ain't good. I been here a few times and this spot never disappoints. I always get their steak tacos, with added onions and cilantro. All their meat for the tacos are cooked all together in the big pan so the meat is super juicy/flavorful. I usually get the steak or the chicken, each costs around $3. They have the cilantro and onions cut up front, so you decide what you want on your tacos! Their green sauce is amazing on the taco, make sure it's the creamy light green one.
author: Lisa W.

description:
3.5 stars rounding down

I bookmarked this place for a long time so I was really excited to try their tacos

The quesadilla my friend ordered... the steak was a whole slice of steak haha versus chopped up steak/steak pieces

my tacos:
Grilled chicken $3 ~ this was the best, yummy and moist
Carne Asada $3 ~ this was ok, nothing out of the ordinary
Al Pastor $3 ~ too salty, don't get it

I like the taco station though because you can add your onion cilantro and white onion

But one visit is enough for me
author: Yeanne L.

description:
3.5/5: I would go again but wouldn't seek this place out. 

Pros: speedy service, lots of seating, great (long) hours.

Cons: grumpy employees (on the night that I went), sloppy burrito that fell apart, flies hovering in the dining area.
author: Katie C.

description:
My favorite spot for authentic tacos in the Mission!

How it works: There is a taco bar in front of the door as you walk in. Tacos are $2.75 each ($3 with tax). If you want anything else (burrito, quesadilla, etc.), there is a second line to order passed the taco bar. Order your food, pay, and then grab a seat.

I got a three tacos and a regular burrito (about $9) to-go on my trip today. The tacos are incredibly fresh, flavorful, and well-portioned! You know this place is authentic when there is an eclectic variety of meats from pollo and carnitas to tripita (beef tripe) and cabeza (beef head). There are also an array of self-serve toppings available -- onions, cilantro, lemons... and of course many different types of salsa.

Tip: Pay with cash. There is a 4% additional charge if you pay with card.
author: Jordan H.

description:
One of my favorite taquerias in San Francisco. My favorite things to get here are the carne asada and pollo asodo tacos, which are made right in front of you. The meat is tender and the tortillas taste very fresh. Make sure to ask for grilled onions, as they don't add it by default. Also make sure to add the garnishes/salsa lined along the taco bar (there's also a separate salsa bar towards the back of the restaurant). The camarones and carne asada plates are also delicious and come with tortillas, rice, beans, salad, etc. The camarones a la diabla in particular is incredible and one of our favorites!!!! The sauce is made with chipotle peppers and has a fiery, roasted kick with lots and lots of heat. We've tried to find somewhere in South Bay that does this dish as well as Taqueria Vallarta but no luck yet.  

The salsa bar is great and has lots of options, including pico de gallo, tomatillo, habanero, etc. I believe they're all made in house. The pico de gallo tastes especially great with the tacos. The tortilla chips (75 cents) are a worthy addition to any meal, mainly because you get to try more of the salsas. Warning, a couple of the salsas are very spicy and will likely cause your stomach to hurt. 

Personally, I love the vibe of the restaurant. Makes me feel like I'm in Mexico. Not fancy by any means, but who cares? It's a taqueria. It's clean enough. And it's delicious. Plus, it's in the nicer part of the Mission, so at least it's a little less sketchy outside. 

Bonus points for accepting credit/debit cards and having a cold water dispenser.
author: Tahmina N.

description:
I like the set-up of the taco bar/taquero  much like you see at home parties etc when you walk into this facility.

I grabbed an Al pastor taco the meat was ready and I was on my way. Solid taco all the way around. 


The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck

10 Little Taqueria

14 Pancho Villa Taqueria

16 Panuchos
17 Taqueria Gudalajara
18 La Palma Mexicatessen
19 El Tonayense
20 Tropisueno
21 La Espiga de Oro

5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme
9 El Norteno Taco Truck
10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description:
This Mexican restaurant is really good! You can get huge burritos, stuffed quesadillas, etc. I also have to say they have one of the best salsa bars in the area. I highly recommend the super quesadilla - it was super good. Also the wet burrito is good as well, but be warned that it is a little spicy!!

The Mission location also have a special deal on the weekends for tacos. I didn't try the tacos when I was there but they have a lot of different choices for meats, etc. Also the tacos are tiny street tacos and if you check in with Yelp and get 4 tacos you can get a free Agua Fresca! So be sure to check in here if you're getting tacos for that free drink.
author: Rithika V.

description:
PROS: 
-With Yelp check in, you get a free agua fresca! The cantaloupe was awesome.
-Lots of options if you're not feeling the meat... Although I did not taste any eggplant in my eggplant burrito.... 
-Salsa bar!

CONS
-I requested (and paid extra for) avocado, which they forgot to put in. Luckily, when I took my burrito back (without my receipt) they gladly gave me a generous portion of avocado on the side (A pro if you watch out!)
-Chips (extra) were too thin and bland for my taste.
author: Roya B.

description: Lady with the silver capped teeth finished her lengthy conversation about an investment she made with a guy who later got arrested. She dropped her cell phone on the floor and picked it up and put it on the food prep cutting board. Really disgusting. What is the health dept rating of this place?
author: Audrey I.

description:
For the vegetarians out their looking for a decent place... they have several items on their menu for vegetarian. Yes, you can go with the basic: beans, lettuce, tomatoes, guacamole, sour cream... but they also have veggie burritos with cactus, eggplant, and various stir fried veggies. There's something out there for everyone. They also have various tortillas so you can go traditional or get your fill with a spinach tortilla. 

I personally really enjoyed their sauce/salsa bar. Everything had a bit of heat, which I loved. Generally I usually only like one or two of the salsa choices, but I enjoyed all 4 of their sauces and also their pico. 

For the meat lovers, they have an abundance of meats for your plates. It's pretty cool that they just continually keep it slow cooking on the griddle and douse your tortilla in a little meat fat to warm it up. My fiancé enjoyed their al pastor tacos the most. 

The location is kind of dingy, which didn't really bother me, but I can see how it may bother some. I walked to the bathroom and noticed they were storing a lot of the prepped food just across the hallway from the bathroom. Ie: meat in metal bins, partially covered in tin foil. Questionable.... but we both ate there and didn't get sick.
author: Roxanna Z.

description:
Upon walking in, I'll have to admit I was slightly skeptical.  We got tacos from the taco cart in the front of the restaurant.  They have a good selection of meats and in all honesty they didn't look bad.  I've been in some classier looking places where the food didn't look that classy.  I would much rather have a place that looked a little more run down, but the food looks excellent.  

My taco go to classics are lengua, cabeza, and suadero.  Wow!  The BEST suadero I've ever had and the tongue was up there as well.  I liked how the tongue was in big tender chunks and not chopped up mush.  You can really tell that whoever cooked this knew what they were doing.  

I really like how they offer grilled onions and that in front of the cart there are the accompaniments.  Most places in Vegas have all that stuff behind the counter and you have to leave it up to them to dish it out for you.  

If I lived in SF, I might be hard pressed to not visit this place at least 3 times a week.  It's that good.
author: Christina R.

description:
My Veggie Burrito tour of the Mission continues. I checked out Taqueria Vallarta today for lunch. I was delighted to find seven vegetarian veggie burritos on the menu which is perfect for a vegan or vegetarian. 

They are $9.25 each & if you add avocado they are $10.25 each. Chips are an additional .75 cents & there is a half dozen item salsa bar. It would be nice if the salsas were labeled yet they weren't so it was trail by fire. Be forewarned that the orange salsa is most likely habanero as it is liquid inferno & is probably the hottest salsa I've ever experienced in my life. 

I decided to go w/ the Manhattan Veggie Burrito. I don't know why it is called Manhattan & perhaps I ordered it because I was born in Manhattan. 

In any case the Manhattan Veggie Burrito comes w/ Carrots, Red Peppers, Broccoli, Yellow Zucchini, Green Zucchini, & Cauliflower. I chose a Whole Wheat Tortilla. Know that it comes w/ rice, beans, hot salsa, cilantro, & onions. For an extra dollar had avocado added to it.

It was a hearty & flavorful burrito. I like this place & can see myself returning in the future as look forward to trying the other vegetarian burritos on offer.
author: Shane S.

description: This place gets better as the night grows longer, but they also offer a lot of menu items not available at other burrito joints, like chimichangas, goat soup, and asada fries. They also offer a variety of veggie options like nopales, and squash blends that aren't typical in this area.
author: Rollo W.

description: I love Taqueria Vallarta. If you don't, you are the one who is missing out on a happy full life. Yes. If you don't eat here, it's my gain. They would want your business, but damn. This is my place. I only bring my friends & family here. I let them waste their money on tourist spots first, then when they want to listen, they will come to Taqueria Vallarta & find a reason to live again. Their tacos are everything to me.
author: Asif H.

description:
We checked out this place at 12:30 am after swing dancing for several hours. 
The only food that came out correct was my corn quesadialla. 

The price was good for everything. 
The service was mediocre.
The big problem was wrong orders

One person got a burrito and it had avocado, they can't have avoado thus ordered a burrito that did not come with avocado in it

Another person in our group ordered a veggie burrito with no cheese. First he got a burrito that was not his, he took it back and they gave him the "right one", this one had cheese in it. The third try was the closest to correct since it only had two pieces of meat in it, when they had specified no meat and no cheese. 

I will only be coming back here if it is my only option in the area. The food itself isn't bad and we were completely fine with the first two mistakes, but after that it got ridiculous. I understand they are getting close to closing, but that amount of mistakes was ridiculous.
author: Tabitha D.

description:
Great burritos! You can tell this place is authentic the second you walk in the door.

As a tip, the vegetarian burrito can be made vegan by asking for the cheese and sour cream to be withheld.

Only thing that felt a bit lacking was the flavor. Would have been nice if the burrito included some time of spicy tomato-based sauce as an option. Rice/beans/avocado by themselves are a bit bland.

Portions were very generous, and the prices were great for SF.
author: Benjamin C.

description: The super burritos here are amazing. They taste so fresh! I will say that the señora at the register needs some customer service skills but besides that I enjoy coming here. Definitely recommend.
author: Thalia D.

description:
Here is my swan song to this taqueria and the history of taquerias that I once knew & loved in SF Mission. 

I had lived there in  the mission for most of my 31 years here in the bay. And Vallarta was just a half block away from my home and stays open late. So what if there were cucarachas and it was a little pine sol stinky. It was my go to place for quesadillas. 

Last night I went in and got a Quesadilla Suiza for $8.77. I will say that perhaps it was good for me to only eat a little bit at 11pm and for that, I am grateful. But that quesadilla was a sham. It was tiny. I guess $8 is discount price here in the over-inflated and inordinately expensive SF Bay area. But hell, I kind of swallowed up that mini-meal in about 4 bites! This is NOT the delicious mexican food that I know of yore, or current. I live in the east bay fyi, and have plenty of go-to cheap places that I frequent. Also, I had to ask for chips (super greasy). 

I will not be going back to that place ever. I think I will stick to east bay taquerias for now!'

Adios!
author: Leslie I.

description: Tacos are good, other then that it's the worst place to eat at night.I ordered food to go a couple times at night  and it just tastes horrible.
author: Jj P.

description:
I like this place because it's pretty decent food.
I dislike this place because they charge for chips, it's usually dirty and can be very loud.
author: nancy w.

description: I used to love this place but today was not okay ! I found a tooth in my taco how gross is this !!! Omg not only is this dangerous but how gross ! Never coming back.. I get some tacos may have bones but a full tooth with root
author: Karina C.

description:
I've eating here before and had the street tacos, having tried it recently I see that the prices have went up but the quality, size and/or presentation at the very least hasn't. I don't think I will make a conscience effort to eat at this place again especially since I can get a better value 2 blocks away.
I hope they read the reviews and consider constructive criticism to improve and keep the doors open.

Mi dos centavos...
author: Tee D.

description:
Really good tacos. Its your typical authentic mission dive. Upon entering there was a seperate taco bar which instantly served me up a suedero taco and a carne asada taco. They grill the meat and toss it on some fresh grilled corn tortillas and you pick your toppings from a good selection.

 Im hispanic and speak spanish but service is rare to non existant. I ordered an elote at the main counter seated myself and ate my delicious tacos. A half hour or so later they tell me if I want an elote still a lady is serving them. I went to a seperate stand and waited in line behind a bunch of random familys who never ordered elotes and was charged seperatly like it wasnt affiliated. Being said the elote was also on point and a good size cob of corn.

The food was all really good tho I felt like the tacos were small even tho only 2.50 per. Takes at least 4 or so for a normal person to be full. Im not the type of person whos always making requests or relies on service but theres no servers and its like your not even there. After you get your food they forget about you so its pretty much on the honor system that you eventually return to the counter to pay before wandering off.
author: Sean G.

description:
I absolutely love this place; this is as legit as it gets.  The tacos are amazing, and cooked to order before your eyes.  There is a great selection of meats, including my favorite, lengua (beef tongue).  I haven't tried the cesos (brain), but it's there for you.  I also haven't tried the vegetarian burritos (including cactus), but they have an impressive selection of those as well.  

Every square inch of the walls and ceiling is covered with murals.  They do have bottled beer.  Best of all, they are open until like 4am or something.  I recommend paying with cash ;)
author: Christian J.

description: I got a regular Pollo Burrito here - I thought it was just okay. The burrito wasn't too enormous, which I like, because recently I've gotten over the whole idea of shoving a Chipotle-sized burrito into your mouth, and sinking into an inevitable food coma. However, the fillings of the burrito were just kinda forgettable; I think the refried beans sort of dominated the experience for me, and the chicken was v forgettable. As far as burritos go, it was just very average - probably wouldn't recommend - however, I can't speak for the tacos or any other items on the menu.
author: Brian W.

description: This place is the real deal. Get the tacos right up front - talk to the Meat Man and get some crane asada tacos for 3 bucks a pop. You won't be disappointed.
author: Alek C.

description: I love their pastor tacos !!!! The guy is really nice, good place to eat!! If you eating only tacos I will recommended u to PAY CASH  or Else the cashier will OVER CHARGED U !!!
author: Myra M.

description: Service is horrible over charge for sour cream and cheese for tacos 4 dollars for sour cream and cheese on four tacos that already cost 3 dollars a piece and racist!
author: Jas C.

description:
Stop by here for a quintessential Mission experience, delicious food, authentic ambience, and diverse locals.

I got the lengua (tongue) and al pastor tacos... yumm! The horchata was a nice sweet spiced finish to the meal. Pro tip: check in for a free agua fresca.

You order right by the grill and pay by the drinks. The line might be long but it goes quick.

They take credit cards too!

Parking might be tough so take public transportation or uber/lyft if you can.

A great, affordable stop in one of my favorite districts in the city.
author: Sue V.

description:
2 words: TACO BAR.

Wife and I visited SF, our Air BNB was in the Mission area and this place was recommended by our hosts. We were blown away. The tacos were SO GOOD and so much meat. Go out of your comfort zone and do it!
author: Herman M.

description: I've came to this taqueria for several years and it's been good until tonight.I feel that the female employees as well as the female manger are extremely unprofessional and did not handle the situation correctly . A group of us came to eat some tacos and while a friend was carrying her 3 tacos one of the employees bumped into my friend that caused her tacos to fall. My friend felt it was an accident but the employee told her she was not at fault and had to pay for the ones that fell  plus the ones that were going to be replaced but in a defensive way. My friend asked the employee why she had to pay for double if it was not her faulty that it fell and stated the employee that bumped into her said she did not do anything to cause that and there we many people that witnesses the situation so we called for the manager and the manger was agreeing with their staff and did not care what we had to say. We tried to explain to  the manager what had happened and she simply said it does not matter and that the customer had to pay for 6 tacos otherwise the the employee had to pay for the tacos. I feel it was a situation that could of been handled differently. Im really disappointed. I do agree that the food is great but the customer service really sucks. I would understand if it was the customers fault but in this case we are talking about 3 TACOAS and it was the negligence of the staff. They definitely need bettercustomer service training on how to handle certain situations. Now they have lost a few customer when it could of been resolved in a more professional manner!!!!!
author: Griselle T.

description: I like this place in theory. It looks authentic enough, is open late, and the staff are decent. The food taste is hit or miss. Sometimes the tacos are moist and excellent, other times they are dry and tasteless, unless you gorge on the salsa. Unfortunately the last time here I ended up with a tummy ache the next day from trying various meat tacos from the round taco cart in the corner. As a result, I don't trust the health safety here. It's too bad because I liked this place.
author: Brian J.

description:
Mmm. Gotta say this is my second time here. First time was years ago on a late night after a bar night. I remember it being hella good and after my first visit in years after that night--I can finally say it's just as good and even better than I remember and I was sober!

Ordered 3 tacos- one carnitas, one al pastor, and one suadero, which is tender beef. It was just delish in about every way.  I also ordered tortilla chips and their salsa was perfect, I got up a handful of times to get more. Their horchata was ok- a little too sweet and too much cinnamon for how I like it.
author: Sharon B.

description:
As other yelpers have mentioned before me, the TACO BAR is the reason why I probably would come back. 

Choose your meat, let the cook know how many, and bam...you have your tacos. He doubles up on the tortillas and the condiments (onions, cilantro, lime, hot sauce, radish) are in front. 

Of course, there is a partition but you are able to see your food being cooked. 

It's also extremely quick for ppl who are on the go. If you have cash, you can just pay the man without having to go to the register. 

Tacos are like...$2.50 each. I also ordered an agua Fresca before I saw the check-in offer. Don't make that mistake. 

And they still sell other famous plates of food: burritos, tortas, etc. that they don't cook in front of you if you're interested in eating more than just a taco! 

Parking is metered street only, but we were able to find something right in front on a Saturday at 6pm.
author: Melanie B.

description:
We called in an order for carne asada fries and an horchata. I walked in to pay for the fries + drink and walked out to our car. We drove home.... no more than 5-7 min. We were so hungry we started to dig in to the fries. We had only taken a few bites and were starting to get to the fries and we instantly stopped eating, the fries were mush. They were not cooked through and were so oily...they had even fused into a pile of mush. The meat was dry and overcooked. The sour cream looked like cottage cheese. There was literally no melted cheese on this plate. We were super disappointed with this order. 

To top it off, our horchata was 75% ice 25% horchata. Not cool. 

We paid 16$ for this disappointing experience.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
We don't have enough late night food spots in the area, so thank goodness for Taqueria Vallarta!

Whether it's 1 in the morning or 1 in the afternoon, I could always use some tacos from one of my favorite taquerias on 24th.

They are friendly, they are fast and they are reasonably priced. You have the choice of a million different types of meats. I usually stick with chorizo, al pastor or carne asada, but my roommate is a huge fan of the lengua. The taco bar is separate from the regular ordering area and is decked out with all the fixings you might want. There's also plenty of space to sit and eat. 

The colorful signage out front is so inviting, too! One of these days I'll have to stop in for something other than tacos and an agua fresca, as I have heard good things about their other foods.
author: Sara M.

description:
Best tacos hands down !!! Been coming here for a year. Make sure you get the tacos right when you walk in, to the right.

Food 5
Cleanliness 4
Service 4
Prices expensive lol 1 but worth it
author: Paris S.

description:
My friends and I came here after a long night out on Post and after a quick search of late night street tacos.

When we arrived, I was disappointed to find that the elotes mentioned in other reviews were not available, which is what drove us to this place as opposed to other restaurants that popped up.

The tacos were okay, but I've had a lot better. I had the beef tongue tacos, and I think I looked a little bit harder than I usually do because for a second, the texture freaked me out that night for some reason. The tongue tacos I had were okay, but not as good of flavor that I usually get from tongue tacos. My friend's choice of al pastor tacos stole the show.

Also, avoid the pineapple drink. It was way too sweet!
author: Niki P.

description: This place has the best street tacos in the city! Every time someone comes to visit me, I take them here, and they love it always. It's a quick eat, and I highly recommend the buche (pork neck).
author: Kimberly R.

description:
As a recent transplant to the city I'm following all the recommendation of all my friends who've been in SF for a while. My foodie of a cousin who has been here for almost a decade kept bringing this place up so I thought it only appropriate to check it out, especially seeing as how it is only a few blocks from my new place. 

My roommate and I got 3 tacos each - a mix of al pastor and carne asada. I don't know if I'm just used to the LA taco truck scene or what, but these were on the pricier side in comparison to what I'm used to in LA (these were $2.50 each, while usually LA is around $1-$1.50). That being said, they were of great quality and the portions of meat were quite generous. In terms of quality this is very comparable to the SoCal taco scene. I liked all the varieties of meat available. Next time I'll be sure to check out all the different kinds of meat, though I'm not sure that I'm adventurous enough to go for the cow brain. 

I liked the generous amount of seating available at this location. It was very bright and colorful inside, with lots of families enjoying their meals next to us. Overall a great experience and I look forward to exploring the menu more next time!
author: Jenny D.

description:
Fantastic Fish Tacos. Terrific Tortilla Chips. Sensational Shrimp Tacos. Possibly one of the best Pico De Gallos I've ever had and it's complimentary with purchase! 

I've only been here twice, but they will forever be planted in my mind. It's funny, they are in San Francisco, but not such an easy trek from North Beach... If they were I would most likely be here on a weekly basis. It's super casual here, order at the counter or taco stand, take your pick, and then they'll bring you heaven on earth, I mean, heaven on a plate (especially if you're a taco connoisseur)!

Take note, all of their sauces, and pico de gallo is on the spicier side, be ready. Parking is a touch tough around here, so anything alternative to driving in would be a better option. Enjoy!
author: Cassandra E.

description: Great enchiladas and they give a special green hot sauce which adds great spice and flavor! The beans and rice that came with the dish were also very good. Highly recommend!!
author: Uma A.

description: The tacos here were super good! Can't beat simple street tacos and they are doing a great job at it. There is plenty of seating inside and was surprised by the seating. Usually the city can be small. All the choices looked excellent and there were even tamales there, set up by a local maker. The line to order was very slow, they don't have 2 separate payment areas for the tacos so it was confusing. They should have it where you pay for tacos then go get them so you don't get them and then wait in line for 15 min while your mouth is watering.
author: Brielle W.

description: Good vegetarian burritos! I got the burrito grill super. The vegetable mix is good with the rice, beans, and cheese. They have really good red chili! Reminded me of my mom's chili she used to make fresh in the blender.
author: Shannon S.

description:
Sunday afternoon sitting in the window looking out into the mission while eating the BEST HOMEMADE TAMALES, SHRIMP AND QUESADILLA plate were generous, fresh, savory, with homemade salsas and cilantro.  

I think my boyfriend  and I came in after they had a really busy Sunday lunch.  Service could have been a little more friendly, but I still loved it.
author: Meagan M.

description:
I love their foods at all hours of the day and night, but they don't listen when you ask the cashier for NO HOT SAUCE. I wonder if they don't understand Spanish?
Les dije sin Chile, sin picante y NO solamente me ignoro la muchacha o NO entiende Español. La comida es deliciosa pero cuando le digo a la muchacha y me ignoran, pues sera la ultima vez.
author: Anthony B.

description: I've been going here for years and didn't realize there's a whole menu of vegetarian burritos above the sauce counter and also the saices are all excellent!
author: john m.

description:
Love that their meats taste like at my childhood home, specifically due to the flat top that resembles northern Mexico's Discada style of cooking. 

Usually get tacos de carnitas, pastor and Suadero. Trying the tamales tonight!
author: Angel M.

description: Stopped by this place after getting a smell of the meats cooking right by the door. It's a pretty decent sized joint with a full menu of Mexican options. What got my attention as I was walking in the mission was the giant pile of meat they had cooking on the flattop by the door. Pretty large selection of meats for tacos, the tacos are diy meaning you order the meat and then you top it the way you want. Reasonable price for the tacos and they were decent. I tried the tacos al pastor, barbacoa, and carne asada. The al pastor were imo the best with the most flavor. The others were ok. I wouldn't go out of my way to go for tacos here but if I were in the neighborhood it wasn't a bad option
author: Peter P.

description:
This is the best taqueria in San Francisco!!! Every time I visit I must have six (6) al pastor tacos from Vallarta's Every. Single. Time!!!

Wait in line for the tacos right by the entrance. If you go inside and wait in the other line to order something other than the tacos than you're a fake Vallarta's fan. 

I usually just get a water cup for my drink but sometimes treat myself to their horchata.
author: Sergio A.

description:
Al Pastor tacos = BOMB.COM

-------------------------------

Couldn't just leave that as a review bc it was too short, so I'll just elaborate a bit more about how great these tacos are. They are perfection.
author: Adrianne R.

description: Quick fast food on the go but the taste and Quality of home cook Mexican authentic meals I love stopping here to get my dinner as I'm going home from work I will eat breakfast here too because they do serve a large breakfast menu but coming one time too many can really make me fat so I will come maybe twice a week because the food is just so good so authentic so flavorful so yummy I can't get enough of this place
author: Mona L.

description:
This is the real deal, one of the best Mexican Restaurants in the Mish. Their tacos are close to what I get when I am at Puerto Vallarta. Does not have the long lines as Farolito and its affordable, plus they have FUTBOL on all their tv sets.

Gotta try them tacos.
author: Em B.

description:
While flying from SoCal to NorCal something happened: a real, live conversation with the person sitting beside me.  The rest of the plane was packed with silent, exhausted youth streaming back from Coachella but this guy, Gen-X not Millennial, had missed it due to family obligations.  A Quinceañera held priority.

When someone of Mexican origin has just attended a Quinceañera and they proceed to tell you "the best, most authentic Mexican tacos I've found in SF are at Taco Vallarta" you listen.  Or rather, I listen.  I headed to Taqueria Vallarta (this location has the best reviews and is open until 1 a.m.) as soon as my plane landed.  

Taqueria Vallarta is exactly why, on a short flight, you should strike up a conversation with the person beside you.  You never know when you'll hit gold.

At Taqueria Vallarta you're two steps through the door before you can order your tacos.  Walk a bit further - or don't, really - and you can order off the larger menu.  Why you would want to, I don't know.

These 2-corn tortilla + protein masterpieces are ready in a nano-second.  Once in hand, a lineup of radishes, onions, cilantro, and salsa confronts you.  Say yes to all then find a table.

We sampled carne asada tacos, pork tacos, and goat tacos which we liked pretty much in that order with that carne asada being a thing of glory.  The tacos are $2.50 nowadays and many people order many.  Four between two people proved filling and ample even if we appeared to be outliers.  

The authentic Mexican street tacos at Taqueria Vallarta are glorious.  The ambiance, not so much.  This is not a place to linger but it's a fabulous place to refuel.  With those tacos being made in the entryway I'm pretty certain I'll never make it to the larger menu and I have no  problem with that.  

The best Mexican street tacos in SF?  Quite possibly.
author: Tracey A.

description:
Get thee here for some buche tacos! I went on a taco crawl in the Mission on a glorious weekend and happened upon their taco bar. I'm using the word "taco" a lot, but just go with it. I can't speak to their other dishes, but them little tacos were a gem.

They're simple, quality, and cheap. $2.50 a pop.

Meat options included barbacoa, carnitas, cabeza (beef head), lengua (beef tongue), chorizo, al pastor (BBQ pork), chicken, tripita (beef tripe), suadero (beef, not sure what body part this is), and buche (sign says pork neck but might actually be pork stomach).

So I don't actually know what pork part I ate, but it was chewy and juicy, like a mix between meat and tendon. The meat was set on the tortilla skin (corn I believe), then the server offered some carmelized onions. Lastly, you serve yourself at the bar and jazz up the taco w whatever you please - cilantro, diced raw onions, green/red sauce, cheese.

I will be back.
author: Cici T.

description:
My friend raved about Taqueria Vallarta's seafood plate/platter so we came here for that. But I was more excited about the taco bar (with exotic meats :P). The two of us ordered: 

Taco Bar - $2.50 each. We ordered 3. I've had pretty darn kick-ass tacos from taco trucks in LA, so I couldn't help but compare the tacos here to street tacos in LA. I would say that the texture of beef tongue, and regular beef tacos that we ordered from Taqueria Vallarta were good, but a bit on the dry and bland side - make sure you ask for the grilled onions! Because the tacos were pretty bland, we had to put A LOT of salsa on the tacos for some flavor. If I were to give LA taco truck tacos an 8, I'd give the tacos here a 5. 

Seafood platter - $22. Not that great imo. They made it with all frozen seafood. The platter came with rice and beans. The frozen seafood just didn't have a good texture. I think our platter went straight from frozen to cooked, there wasn't even a thawing process. So the seafood tasted like firewood, too chewy/dry, just not right. I wouldn't order this again. 

The place isn't super clean, but the ambiance felt authentic. There was also a homeless guy sitting in the restaurant when we were there (I wanted to give him our leftovers, but he left before we finished). Bathroom is huge but not amazingly clean. Staffs weren't wiping tables or whatnot.
author: Dana Z.

description: Their steak and cabeza tacos are bomb and agua frescas, their mariscada wasn't that good I personally think it needed more flavor.
author: Elva S.

description:
This is such an interesting place! 3 different places to order either elote, tacos, or everything else.

It was my first time here and I came with my brother, who can't stop raving about the elote. We got it both in a cup and on the cob. The cup was easier to eat, but there's something about eating corn on the cob that's way tastier! I think the ratio of toppings ended up being better on the cob as well but both were delicious.

We also got the quesadilla castillito with lengua, carne asada + camarones combo, and a side of cebollitas. Let me just say the lengua was the best lengua I've ever had, and the quesadilla was so delicious. Definitely the tastiest thing we ordered. It was like a pressed burrito, very very filling and not just full of cheese like some other places do quesadillas. The cebollitas I guess I expected to be grilled a little more but those were also very tasty. The combo plate wasn't amazing as the carne asada was overcooked but everything else on the plate was great.

Can't wait to come back again with an empty stomach!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I've been searching for tacos comparable to what I had for the past 4 years in SD, and while I still haven't found my SF equivalent, this is definitely ranked pretty high. 

My favorite thing about this place was the toppings bar. I absolutely hate cilantro and I love that I can simply skip the cilantro bowl and add the toppings I want. The red salsa was the best and added a nice spicy flavor to the tacos; the dark red salsa reminded me of Asian chili sauce and while it packed a punch, it didn't add much flavor wise. 

I liked the smokiness of the carne asada the best, and the meat was quite tender. The cabeza was good too although definitely a fattier option. I felt like the carnitas was a little dry but still had a nice sweet pork flavor. Now the al pastor... I have this horrible habit of comparing any al pastor taco to that of Tacos el Gordo in SD, and I know that in doing so I'll never be satisfied by anything other than that. It was good, but I just wish that it was sweeter and spicier.

At $2.50 each, this was honestly a pretty good price for SF, and the double layered tortilla made it a filling meal. There's a lot of seating inside but not a lot of parking outside - took a few circles around the block before I found a spot so I recommend taking public transportation. I'd definitely be back to satisfy my taco cravings!
author: KC W.

description:
I'm glad my roommate brought me here. It was one of those times where we'll just pick a restaurant on the fly. I have been to most of the taqueria's in the mission but this was my first time here. We came on a Tuesday night around 9 pm. I know most taqueria's only accept cash so I was a bit unprepared but they take card here. 

As soon as you walk in there is a taco station where you can order tacos for $2.50 each no matter the type of meat. It was a Tuesday so I had to get them. I ordered one chicken and one carne asada. They were just the right amount as I wasn't hungry but could use a bite since I just got out of doing some work. It was quick and my roommate commented that this was the only place that serves tacos directly like that. 

Other than tacos there are many other options from your standard taqueria. What I really enjoyed from eating here was the ambiance. The place has wonderful murals that really brought me back to what the city was like when I was a kid. Overall, I'd give this place the nod for a new experience that's out of the normal Mission Taquerias.
author: Dan G.

description: It's San Francisco so take Bart. It's a hit or miss depending on your luck. This place is so good. They cook the the tacos in front of you as you walk in. They have about 10 types of different meats. They also have grilled onions. They have a big salsa bar. They sell corn with all the fixings. They have a lot of aguas frescas really good I must add. There is a lot of seating for small and large parties. The bathrooms are in the back they're kind of scary. The tacos are so freakin good here. This is one of my favorite places to eat when I go to frisco. Very few places compare . 5 stars across the board. Highly recommend this spot.
author: Isaiah G.

description:
Taco line out the door! Because its cracking. They have a separate taco cart inside the restaurant and it's Super yum and i hate mexican food. Burritos are good too and the staff is friendly. On top of that they have radishes... cuz i need my radish with my taco n burrito!!!! Goodbye El Farolito this is my spot for when I'm feeling like mexican!!! Also lots of space to dine in as well. And Ohhh emmm jeee the corn there from then corn lady f@ckin goes!!! Its helluh good, its like crack corn! U can get it on the cob or cut up into a cup with fresh cheese and only $3. It's a whole lotta goodness in ur mouth... FFL!!! Check it out if ur in the mission/24th street area or
Hood!
author: Theresa M.

description: Found this place on yelp! Food was delicious. Steaming and cooking as you walked in. Looked like a hole in the wall taqueria from Mexico. The food was delicious. I had the carne asada tacos and these had big chunks of meat. Tacos had a heaping amount of meat on them and then they have a toppings bar to dress them as you like. To quench my thirst I had a Pina Agua Fresca. Very refreshing and left you wanting more.
author: Pedro P.

description: Ordered several tacos (al pastor, carne asade, carnitas, and chorizo). All were full of authentic flavor and not dried out like a lot of taco meats at other restaurants. Service was fast, and the salsa bar featured a lot of great sauces and peppers. Learned afterwards that there is a surcharge when paying with a credit card. Nevertheless, excellent tacos.
author: Todd P.

description: If you're walking down near Mission, you need to grab some street tacos from here. Everything is cooked to order. There are a variety of meat options from carne asada to pastor to lengua. Being from Texas, we have pretty high taco standards and this place is worth checking out.
author: Benji D.

description: Every time hubby goes here to eat lunch he brings me back tacos. Why? because I fcukn love tacos! My favorite are the suadero, carnitas, lengua, and pork neck. So juicy and flavorful. I wish I can have elote and tamales. Ugh the pictures on here are so good that I'm licking my phone. Didn't care too much for the carne and al pastor. It wasn't what I anticipated, and the carne seemed dry. This place is also open late, which great for noc shift workers and drunkies. Win, Win, YEAAAAAAH TACOOOOOS!
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
I'll update my review if I ever come back for their tacos - & by tacos I'm referring to the simple fare you'd find in México: corn tortillas topped w/ grilled meat & little else. 

I stopped by Taqueria Vallarta on my quest to sample different versions of my go-to San Francisco cheap meal: the "super veggie taco." I should've known something wasn't right when I searched for a 'veggie taco' on their menu & didn't see anything. Another issue with not finding what you're looking for on the menu is not knowing the price. 

At $4.30 (& without chips!), Taqueria Vallarta's super veggie taco is the most expensive veggie taco I've ever purchased in the Mission. It wasn't worth it & I would only come to Taqueria Vallarta if you're looking for Mexican [street] tacos. Other reviewers have given me the impression that their burritos are mediocre & overpriced as well. 

The joint is filled with Spanish-speaking folks and made me feel like I was in México, which are both good signs, but I'm never coming back for a veggie taco. Next time it's gonna be carnitas or al pastor!
author: Beau W.

description:
Take my hand and step into a real taqueria. You won't find any of those $5 boujee tacos here. Just street tacos on street tacos for $2.50 each. 

There are two ways to order. The first is as you walk in where you can order at the taco cart. The second option is to order at the traditional counter. 

Trust me, order at the cart as there is nothing else like this ina brick and motor establishment in the SF area.
author: Joshua F.

description: Mediocre food and the rudest cashier I've ever met..even after a tip. I don't think I'll be returning here.
author: Meghan P.

description: We came from Los Angeles and being hungry but the food was not as good considering the cost of the food. The flavor was bland and the service wasn't good either. I would say it's over priced for mediocre food.
author: Alejandra G.

description: Best street tacos I've had in the Bay Area hands down !!! They are even comparable to the ones in San Diego ! $2.50 per street taco! I had the carne asada tacos with all the fixings . The corn tortillas were crispy and crunchy  and the meat flavor was on point .  We really wanted to try the elotes but the rude cashier said no more lol . Besides the rude cashier we will come back to try more things ! Hopefully they will have the corn next time ! Itching to come back already :)
author: Monica M.

description: Going off of the food alone, everything was delicious. Service can best be described as "suspicious" but I don't blame them. They probably put up with some nonsense. The value and the salsa make up for the side-eye imho, just don't forget to let your burrito cool off :)
author: Evan M.

description: Great place to go with your family or friends. Great food and quick service. Parking as always is rough but overall, good food.
author: Andres G.

description: What can I say, great authentic tacos for great prices. The meats are flavored nicely. They open late too. The only drawback is it doesn't appear very clean. The tables still have trash and food on them and I wasn't a big fan of the open taco bar as I saw a lady in front of us grab a lime with her bare hands, put it back in the container and grab another *cringe*. It's still great tasting tacos nonetheless.
author: Julie N.

description: Great spot for cheap tacos with a ton of flavor! It is cash only,  they are open late night, always busy but the service is fast
author: Ange R.

description:
Enchiladas verdes which were not verde, possole, and $3.25 mango drink: $28.55

Everything was missing some flavor, so the enchiladas were lame and the possole was not good in any way. 

My craving for "Sanborns" (a chain in Mexico) enchiladas was disappointed, so I am bummed out.
author: MICHAEL W.

description: This place is simply disgusting and the people there are rude, this is my first and last visit.. they have zero heigine, I wonder what's their health inspection score, if it's anything over 50 then they must have bribed the health inspector.
author: Shahi I.

description: Simple review:  eat here.  Authentic, affordable, multiple types of meat.  Had the cabeza, lengua, buche, carne asada.  Open late
author: Andrew L.

description:
This has become my go-to spot for a taco fix. Ordering is quick and easy - the taco cart is right by the entrance, just pick your meats and dress them up. Toppings include salsas, onion, cilantro, radish, and lime. Continue to the main counter inside to pay, and there's also a salsa bar to the left of that counter. 

Tacos are $2.50 apiece right now, and they also have a full menu with all the Mexican comfort food you can stomach. I keep going back to the tacos, though - lengua and carnitas are always amazing!
author: Delia Z.

description: Bargain tasty tacos. Very casual setting.
author: Cassie T.

description: Lingua and al pastor are the tacos to get.  The tacos look like they are made in Mexico City.  I've never been to Mexico City.
author: Fatty A.

description:
I went to Mission for yoga, but with a burrito in my mind the whole time! Per usual, I yelped a place to get elote, and found Taqueria Vallarta. They also have tamales (PLUS!). Went kinda late, so found parking right in the front, but I can see how that could be a problem using busy hrs. As you walk thru the door, immediate to the right is the taco bar. You can order straight thru there if you have cash, or wait in line to pay with credit card. Then you'll find the tamale and elote station on the left, again, order directly from the lady if you have cash. Finally, all the way in the back is the register in which you order burritos. 
The super burrito was great! I loved the carne asada, which was super flavorful! I also got a pork (or chicken, I forget) tamale. Yummms!
The elote on the other hand was a little disappointing. They use boiled corn instead of grilled corn, so it was very soggy. I also asked for extra chili, which made it a little too salty (well that's my fault).
Additionally, they had some amazing salsa.
As I mentioned earlier, you can order everything at the register if you are paying with a credit card. however, they don't give you a receipt or any kind of paper stating that you paid for everything, so when I went to the two stations to get my food, they looked at me weird, questioning if I have already paid. The lady at the elote station even asked someone to go to the register to double check that I paid...Well, let's say I wasn't very happy about that. Maybe they should change their system a little bit so they don't think I'm taking their food without paying.
author: Anna Y.

description: At the front near the door, there's a lady who will heat up the tortillas for your $2.75/taco in the middle of a taco meat hexagon. I got chorizo and carnitas; ok tacos but not amazing. Large eating space with every bit of wall, including the ceiling, covered in murals. Cash only; they have an atm machine.
author: Ricky D.

description: Terribly rude employees.. don't come here unless you want to be served what you didn't order on purpose and then stared at..
author: Desmond B.

description: I like there tacos here but for $3.00 a taco is expensive. I feel the price vs. meat ratio in the taco just doesn't match in quantity. I feel this place is a rip off . A good quality taco you'd expect sufficient meat but not here. I asked for extra meat and they charged me $1.50. Half of price of taco cost. It's the hype of the famous pan cook meat. Overall 4 for the taste of food and 3 stars for the little amount of meat they put in your taco.
author: Cristina S.

description:
I'm more of a quesadilla guy, but as soon as I saw the taco grill upon walking in, I flip-flopped faster than a politician during election season.

Along with the usual meats like carnitas, chicken, etc, they also have beef tongue, beef head, pork neck and a bunch of others.  I wolfed down seven tacos, the most number of units I've moved at a Mexican restaurant, and washed it down with a Corona.  

Next time I will attempt to top that number.
author: Tommy Q.

description: Great tacos & variety of meats. Their salsa bar was good too with a great variety of salsa & the  spiciness of them were great! Their agua frescas are home made & fresh. Definitely recommend the jamaica.
author: Jackie F.

description: Great tacos, quick, clean, lots of options. Exactly what you want a taco place to be.
author: Garrett H.

description: Now there is a lot of hype on who has the best taco / burrito in all the SF land and the search is about to be over bc im about to drop some hot knowledge on you!!! Listen to me when I speak - the tacos here are literal happiness they are salty and juicy and those corn tortillas yum o baby. I appreciate simplicity and Vallarta is all about letting the flavors in a good Taco stand out for itself like yes baby pile on some cilantro and onions bc that's all u need for some heavenly goodness and DONT forget to eat a burrito it's salty and I like salty bc I'm a little person who has a lot of anger in me but iTs the good kind of salty like not where it's just salty but salty and tangy and zesty and oooooo sex chat!!!
author: Yoona C.

description: I love the food the cashier lady with the blonde streaks in her hair is pretty rude she walked off on me then couldn't even ask me a time frame of when my food will be done I asked u know how long she said no and said next ... won't be coming here again will go to the one on mission and Persia
author: DeL G.

description:
Their tacos remind me of home. 
They have a variety of meats.
Agua frescas were also great!
Salsa verde!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Vanessa H.

description: My family had mixed reviews on this place. I came with a large group. There are many choices on the menu, and different lines to stand in; I was confused about which line to be in, who to pay, get my own drink or wait, wait for food order or sit?  The cashier was not helpful. I ordered the fish taco and it was awful! Greasy, more fish "skin" than meat; it arrived well after everyone else at my table had gotten their food, and it was barely warm...yuck. But my daughter ordered a fried fish which was great. Others in my group raved about the taco bar, which was a great $value for authentic Mexican flavor (oh, THAT was the line I wanted!). Would I try this place again in the future? Maybe, for the taco bar
author: Eliz S.

description:
Affordable and delicious.

Tacos are $2.50 each and I loved their al pastor tacos. No pineapple but still satisfying. 

My husband and I got here around 1PM on a Sunday, but line wasn't too long and moved fairly quickly. When you walk in, you'll find a man making tacos at a cart. You order the tacos there then an employee will tell you to get in the cashier line (if there is one) to pay. I almost ate all the tacos while waiting in line to pay, because of the glorious scent. I also didn't realize how big the menu was!
author: Jenn H.

description: The tacos and burritos here are fantastic! The carnitas burrito was one of the best I've ever had. Top 5. This is the spot!
author: Reynaldo P.

description: Sometimes it's not obvious where to eat in the mission, especially to get delicious tacos. The first impression might be inviting since you see the cook outside with his taco stand with bins of cilantro, onions, salsas, and steam rising from his frying of meat and warming the tortillas. The meets or what you would expect, and my favorites are the beef, grilled chicken, pork Carnitas, with grilled onions... all very simple and not spicy. You then dress them yourself to your liking  with all the condiments they offer. You can either pay and then eat, or eat first and then paid. It's very casual and honorable.
author: Ron W.

description: Hands down a delicious cheese quesadilla. Ordered a veggie burrito which I was delighted in it simplicity but magnificent flavors
author: Sam S.

description:
So I went there tonight for the first time after an event. I saw they had pupusas, and I had a hankering for some, so that was awesome. The pupusas were fresh, flakey and a little crisp on the outside, tender and flavorful on the inside. If this experience was evaluated only on the food alone I would definitely go back. my issue with thi place came up as I passed by their bathroom.

I saw that their bathroom was explicitly labeled "gender neutral, which would be awesome. As a trans person for whom bathroom access rights is a really important issue the fact that they actually have a bathroom that is literally gender neutral is great! The problem is with their bathroom SIGN, which appears to depict a male-presenting person climbimbing above a barrier to peep at a female presenting person. That is an icredibly problematic sign for a gender-neutral bathroom, and when I sought out a management level person and told them my concern their response was since this wasn't their business there wasn't anything they could do. So as a food appreciater, this place makes good food. As a trans person for whom being able to pee safely is a basic civil right...I'm left feeling uncomfortable. My hope is there's something they can do to rectify this situation.
author: Cass L.

description: TACO BAR! Less than $2 each! Literally all you need to know. Huge extensive menu. The only thing I wish was bigger was their shrimp cocktail. I'm used to a ginormous one. But the taco bar just takes the cake and there's a lot of seating so go give it a try!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I went in here and was a little hesitant for paying $2.50 for a street taco, they raised it to a greedy $2.75. The average person can eat 4 of these but for an $11.00 price tag their are certainly much cheaper taqueria's nearby.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
Great street tacos right as you walk in. Literally. There's a wide selection of meats like cow head, lengua, barbacoa, and carne asada to name a few.

Order at the taco stand inside the door, grab your tacos which are served in less than a minute, add your own toppings (finely diced onion, lime wedges, sliced radish, chopped cilantro, 3 different types of sauce), and pay at the register in the back. You can also order from the rest of their food menu and drinks there.

Just speaking for the tacos, they're tasty, good amount of meat, and only $2.50 a taco no matter what meat you choose. I ordered one al pastor and one grilled chicken. I loved the al pastor; great flavor and juicy! Chicken was on the dry side though.

The tortillas were also warmed which seems like a given but sadly not all places do this and it really does make a positive difference.
author: Lindsey C.

description: This is one of my all-time favorite places since my SF State college days!! Authentic & oh so yummm.
author: Candice N.

description: This place is amazing  the food dude do not get me started it is amazing  the service  very fast and the wait is up too 10 or more to get your food to your table .
author: Diego T.

description: Two years later this is still my favorite Mexican in the city. Maybe I have a soft spot for it because it's the first Mexican I had when I moved here. I love the salsa bar and the staff is friendly. As a bonus (but really should be the standard!) you get free chips. Also the price is right and you get a very generous portion. If I'm feeling reasonable I can make the burrito last two days!
author: Emma B.

description:
Super good Mexican place (but duh, it's in the mission). Absolutely will be coming back. 

So what's unique? Well it beats the competition a couple key ways:
-Unique (at least that I've seen) menu items (atole, elote)
-Uncommon menu items (piña tamales, Barbacoa)
-AMAZING salsas (all of them)
-Open til 330AM?!

The tacos and chips are also really good.

What's not so good?
-Prices are a bit higher / lower value than say el farolito
-Items are spread out across multiple registers (though this is also pretty charming)
-Burritos and nachos aren't quite as good as other places - UNTIL you add the amazing salsa.

Definitely can't wait to come back.
author: Chris S.

description:
I ordered the fish tacos from the main register. It was the best fish taco I've ever had.

Why?
- delicious lightly fried fish
- hot spicy sauce
- sweet and savory fried onions

The cacophony of flavor blew my mind. Looking forward to ordering again holy moly
author: Arjun M.

description:
Great place for tacos all kinds of meat to choose from
Just make sure you have cash the cashier on evenings is not accurate with charging people when paying with a card.
I was double charged using my card she claims the machine was not working others have had the same issue charged incorrectly when she's on.
Eventually I was reimbursed in cash after having to get a bank statement per her request
author: Lupe C.

description:
I love tacos and this place is legit!  $2.50 for street tacos (darn inflation).  I gots carnitas and lenguas, both were bomb.  They grill the meat right in front of you and it smells amazing.  

CA$H ONLY.
author: Lyn C.

description:
Writing this review as I still pick the little pieces of food out of my mouth. Tmi? Sorry..

Delicious.

I have always wanted to try this place and boy am I glad I did. I walked in on a Saturday night with my girlfriend starving and craving a burrito. The place was busy but not too bad. About 7 people in front of us in line, but it moved quickly. 

Fast forward to the burrito part. It was tasty and hearty. The al pastor in the burrito was excellent and well worth it. My girlfriend got the California burrito, and I had a few bites and it was good. But for my personal taste I would get the California Burrito Missing style next time, which comes with beans, salsa and lettuce. 

Overall this place was great. A new burrito spot discovered and loved. I will definitely be back not only for the burrito, but they have a taco bar that looked amazing and for only 2.50 you can't go wrong. Excellent taqueria! 

5/5 burritos!
author: John James M.

description: Authentic Mexican food. Tacos are where it's at. A lot of different types of meat to try, which are not as common. Just be careful with eating here frequently as it could come back to haunt you ;)
author: Kaveh M.

description:
I guess it's mediocre, much like most of the Mission Taqueria's, this one is nothing to write home about.

In fact my favorite thing about this meal was the avocado on top, believe it or not, which of course is not saying much.

Of course, I ordered the enchiladas and not their burrito, but hey, you would think that they'd be able to do a better than average job with that.

Apparently not.
author: Jack R.

description:
Not as good as expected! 

I live in LA and I was excited to try a burrito in San Francisco. Unfortunately taqueria vallarta didn't do it for me. The mission district was fun to explore, the restaurant has a lot of character but the burrito left much to be desired. I got the regular carne burrito. It was very dry and the flavors weren't anything to write home about. I thought maybe I could solve the dryness with the salsa but they were all too hot for that. 

Pros:
Good value
Great salsas
Fun neighborhood
Interesting decor

Cons:
Burrito was very dry
Salsas are too spicy to solve the dry burrito crisis

Conclusion:
I really wanted to like this place but the dry burrito really let me down. Quality was consistent with your average run of the mill taqueria.  I would like to go again and get the tacos which looked much better.
author: Jake M.

description: Delicious tacos! Asada was soooo yummy. When you walk in there's a lil taco counter where you can order your TACOS only there. If you want anything else, u have to go to the register. Also, if you have cash & ur just getting tacos, you can give it to the taco man. They also have delicious Elotes. So yummy & juicy. They start to run out by the end of the night so get them while you can. Place looks a bit dirty, especially the bathroom. Parking is really hard to find. Was driving around on the street for about 15 minutes just driving up & down the street. It's metered parking & there's a lot of other food places & bars & such around the area so that's why parking is a bit tedious. Other than that, the tacos and elotes were great! Would definitely come back if Im in San Francisco again.
author: Alicia R.

description:
This place is amazing! 
Super authentic Mexican food at very reasonable prices. Best tacos I've ever had! We had the al pastor and the carne asada.
author: Gina M.

description:
Taqueria Vallarta is my go-to taco place when I'm on 24th St! Sure, occasionally I might go for a burrito, but I usually stop by this place when I'm looking for a cheap meal filled with taco goodness.  My standbys are usually the carnitas and chorizo varieties, but I've tried the buche (pork stomach) before and keep telling myself that I will be more adventurous in the future.

My usual routine is to pick up some tacos from the grill/"tacos al vapor" area (you can pay right there as well without going to the cash register) and find an empty table to devour my taco bounty.  This is definitely not a fine-dining establishment, but it's great if you are looking for a quick meal in the Mission.
author: Keith H.

description: Cheap fast food quality service and fresh meat. All I could ask for in my taco! And the super burrito is huge and could easily be saved for later. The horchata, pineapple, strawberry, and jimica agua frescas are soooo yummy. Definitely my go to spot for tacos in the city!
author: Alison S.

description: This is a great authentic spot to grab a huge burrito or some fantastic tacos.  They have a large menu and use quality ingredients that contain a ton of flavor.  Friendly staff and a friendly atmosphere, open late with seating for many, this is a great spot to come with family or just to grab some quality food! I prefer the burritos here over those at la taqueria around the corner and this is very quickly becoming a go to lunch/dinner spot for this satisfied customer.
author: Jake B.

description: How can they mess up Mexican food on 24th in the mission? How is that possible? And why are there so many positive reviews? This place is disgusting, the whole place is disappointing. Disorganized, dirty and chaotic. Nothing about this place is ok. Went in simply for tacos. That's all I wanted, good old fashioned street tacos. 3 tacos, asada, chorizo and tripas. The asada was just bad. Poorly cut and drenched in the nasty juices of the other meats. The chorizo was mushy, flavorless and light in color. I think the gross soyrizo from Trader Joe's is better. I'm not going to say much about the tripas because they were ok. Just ok. And ok, I get charging $2.75 a taco, but is it really necessary to charge .94cents for a convenience charge of using your card? Please save yourself from having to use their restroom.. you know exactly what I am talking about (typical unkept smelly, afraid to touch knobs etc). Don't do it, keep walking past the flashy colors and signs.
author: Sharon V.

description: Best Tamales in town- $2.50 each. My wife is Mexican heritage and has sampled tamales throughout the city and this is the best by far in SF! The tamales are large with generous portions of flavorful chicken & pork. The masa is moist and soft and they offer sweet (fresa- strawberry) & savory ones. The taco bar and meat was average, a little dry for me, perhaps a 2-3Star. Overall, its an affordable and local watering hole for the community.
author: Scooter C.

description: Solid taco bar place with all sorts of meats to choose from. Lengua and carnitas are my favorite. Will return for sure
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Deals for days on tacos to be the filler and to satisfy the munchies that one has after bar hopping in the Mission area!

This place has spacious seating area too!

Cash only!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I have no idea how this place has high reviews. I ordered a Super Burrito. Holy crap it was terrible. Bland. No Salsa. I got tired of chewing. 

I hated the food here. It went beyond "not good" to straight "bad". Just Terrible. 

Uber eats failed me again.
author: Patrick W.

description: May or may not have gotten food poisoning here from the chicken soup... but the tacos and plates are delicious. Service is kind of slow but there is a sauce bar and plenty of chips!
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Taco 1/6 on our hunt to find the best tacos in San Francisco. We ranked this one #3. They have a nice system down, you start with a paper plate at the beginning of an assembly line, the cook gives you the corn taco with your choice of meat on top, and then you get to pick your toppings out of radish, cilantro, onion, and lime. Then, you continue to move down the line to pay at the register. Probably the best logistics out of the authentic taco places in Mission. Plus, there's actually plenty of room at tables to eat. Most of the other "hot" spots we went to didn't have that. 

Meat 5/5, tortilla 5/5, service 5/5, atmosphere 5/5.

This is the place to go if you want some authentic Mexican food.
author: Hideko T.

description:
Dirt cheap tacos, open late at night on weekends atleast. The tacos were tasty and they were cooked pretty quickly. They offer open bar for salsas and veggies so thats always nice.
Plenty of sitting area and the place was clean.
author: Arjan N.

description: The best Mexican food in the bay! The meat is always so fresh and delicious. The food is pricey, and parking is horrible, but the food is worth the trouble! There's about 7 types of meat, and the flavored water is bomb.
author: Sierra C.

description: I eat here about once a week. They have a quite extensive menu. It's a great choice for vegetarians especially; there around 8 different veggie burrito options which is pretty unheard of. The burritos vary a little based on who is cooking, but they are always good.
author: Shannon Y.

description:
Pretty bomb.com 
I'm inlove with their taco's and how cheap they are. The taco stnd they have near the entrance is pretty genius with how the grill has different triangles sections of the different meats. Each taco is $2.50
author: Stacey M.

description: If you know me, or follow me on yelp, you'll see there's this pattern that I have, and that is CHECKING IN TO TAQUERIAS. I am a big big big big fan of tacos and this place right here.. hit a home run for me. Their tacos are delicious!! I love that there's a taco bar station area where you can add on the hot sauces that you want, cilantro, onions, whatever you like! Their tamales are good as well. I will definitely be back for some more tacos!!
author: Jane N.

description: Lovely tacqueria. One of the best in the Mission. Only problem is if you order anything other than a burrito, it will take a long long time, and you made need to remind them you made an order.
author: Jay B.

description:
Wow! These are some of the best tacos we've ever had - very flavorful meat, great corn tortillas, and some really spicy salsas if you so choose. I had the Pollo Asado (grilled chicken) and Al Pastor (pork) and both were very good, I'll get them again. We also ordered some chips (there's a salsa bar with verde, habanero, avocado, and pico salsas). I also had an horchata. For 4 tacos, chips & salsa, and horchata - the total came to $14. We will definitely be back.

We found this place while on a Detour of the Mission Murals. It's a really cool app that I found through a Yelp event - you go on walking tours of SF neighborhoods whenever you want, and the Detours are narrated by people that live in the area and can tell the real stories. Definitely check it out!
author: Kendra N.

description:
I was not feeling the food here at all.  Not sure if I ordered the wrong thing since most people here seemed to rave about the tacos, but I got a taste of the chicken burrito and carne asada con camarones and neither left me with a lasting impression that would make me want to come back.

The chicken burrito was very salty and I couldn't even tell what I was eating.  Looked like a brown mess inside with some noticeable guac and sour cream mixed in between.

The carne asada con camarones took a long time to come out and was only okay.  A third of the plate was covered in cheese and refried beans, none of which I like.  I'm not sure if you can order without and get more of something else if you don't want beans/cheese but I didn't try asking.  That's my b on my part, but the rest of the plate wasn't very impressive anyways.  The carne asada was very thinly sliced and quite dry.  I think the only decent tasting items on the plate were the grilled green onions, shrimp, and mushrooms.  Everything else was just meh.

It seems to be a pretty popular place in the Mission... hyped if you ask me. I'll stick to the South Bay's Mexican, I've had better there.
author: Carena N.

description: It's always busy but service is great. They are efficient and polite. They also don't put up with rude, racist assholes. Good place for nice Mexican food.
author: Anja H.

description: In my opinion this is the best taco spot in San Francisco! The tacos are always fresh and hot. I love how you order right when you take your first step inside. Carne asada and carnitas are my favorite. Gotta have the cilantro, a little bit of onions, lime, oh and can't forget the grilled onions as well. Price is not too bad and they are usually open past midnight. My go to taco spot in SF!
author: Michael T.

description: We were looking for a Mexican food place on our drive and were just hoping for something decent. This place way exceeded our expectations as the food was tasty, fast and cheap. The staff was also super friendly and attentive.
author: Kristen N.

description:
After a long day in the sun playing kickball and drinking beers across town, my roommates and I decided it was time to head home to marathon Orange is the New Black, but not before grabbing burritos. 

They had a craving for Shrimp with Carne Asada, so we bounced around from La Espiga de Oro, which has never done me wrong, to Las Palmas, to Guadalajara (yes, this is part of my life with these gals) before finally ending up at Taqueria Vallarta. 

I love their taco and salsa bar and my previous review was basically an ode to their burrito, but yesterday something was not right. I ordered a Super Carne Asada burrito with extra jalapeños and my friends both got a mix of Shrimp and Carne Asada. we filled up some cups of salsa and waited for our food.

I got mine pretty quickly, but theirs took 10 or so minutes. It's funny because they saw that their burritos were ready and waiting on the back counter but the cashier was shucking corn instead of bagging them up or calling them over. It was also excessively hot and smoky in the restaurant. Anyway, we got our food and went home to start the food / OITNB marathon. 

As soon as I took my first bite, I got a distinct sensation of chewing on tin foil or plastic because of how rubbery the jalapeños were and much of the carne asada was bone dry.
